abuse_type.question: Which form(s) of abuse are you experiencing?

tips.template: If you face {abuse_type} abuse, remember you don't have to face it alone. Reach out to your emergency contact right away.

logging_incidents.question: Are you recording the incidents (dates, times, details)?

data.Yes: Log each incident (date, time, and a brief note) so you have clear records if needed later.
data.No: Even brief notes on your phone can be helpful. Start logging today.

contact_name.question: Name one person you can call immediately in an emergency.

tips.template: Save {contact_name} in your phone under a code-word so you can quietly call them when you need help.

leave_timing.question: When do you plan to leave?

tips.template: Set a real target {leave_timing} and pack one essential item each day until you're ready.

essentials.question: Do you have a go-bag pack with essentials?

data.Yes: Great! Keep your go bag in a hidden spot so you can grab it quickly
data.No: Pack a simple go-bag today with essentials like your ID, some cash, and a charger.

money_location.question: Where do you keep emergency cash or cards?

tips.template: Stash some cash and a spare card in {money_location}, a spot your partner won't suspect.

safe_house.question: Have you identified a safe place to stay?

data.Yes: Make sure {temp_shelter} knows you may arrive unexpectedly and how to contact you.
data.No: Reach out to Victim Services Toronto or a trusted friend now to secure a shelter option before you leave.

contact.question: Has the abuser continued any contact?

data.Yes: Since you've heard from them, stay vigilant and keep your protection order handy if you have one.
data.No: Even without contact, keep your doors locked and your phone on in case you need to call 911.

protection.question: Do you have a protection order?

data.Yes: Carry your {legal_order} at all times and share copies with anyone who needs to know.
data.No: Consider applying for a protection order; it can help deter unwanted contact.

safety.question: Are you using any safety tools (cameras, door alarms)?

data.Yes: Make sure you're {equipment} is in working order and placed where you'll notice it.
data.No: Consider installing a simple door alarm or camera to alert you to unexpected entry.
